result.execSummary:
The defendant Timblia Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Timblia Williams in court with attorney Paige Aleece Styler.  Defendant Timblia Williams in custody.  Jeffrey James Altenburg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Discussions held off the record.  
On the record.  Dept of Corrections moves to terminate probation based on the fact that defendant has met all conditions of probation. No objection from the state.  Court GRANTS motion and orders termination of probation.

Court date of 03/20/2015 at 08:30 a.m. is rescheduled to 03/20/2015 at 01:30 p.m.

Attorney Paige Aleece Styler in court.  Defendant Timblia Williams is at Behavioral Health.  Jeffrey James Altenburg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.

DISCUSSIONS HELD OFF THE RECORD.

BACK ON THE RECORD.
Case calendared to discuss the status of the Chapter 51.  The final hearing of the Chapter 51 hearing is scheduled for March 6, 2015.  Parties advised the Court that the commitment of the defendant is likely to go forward.  If committed the Department of Corrections will file a petition for early termination of the defendant's probation.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in room 509 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled on March 20, 2015 at 8:30 am.
ORDER OF CONVERSION TO CIVIL COMMITMENT PROCEEDINGS UNDER ss971.14(6) SIGNED AND FILED.

Defendant Timblia Williams in court with attorney Paige Aleece Styler.  Defendant Timblia Williams in custody.  Jeffrey James Altenburg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Return on doctor report held.  Defendant is not now compentent and is unlikely to regain compoentency in the time frame allowed.  Corporation Counsel si to draft a plan for civil comittment and provide same at the next court date.

Defendants request to remain in the county jail pending the next court date is denied by the court due to medical and prescription medication reasons.  Court ordered the defendant returned to Wisconsin Resourch Center pending the next court date.  Hearing scheduled for 02-17-2015 at 08:30 am.

Discussion held off the record.  Matter before court for a status conference.  The defendant has approximately 40 more days to serve on his sentence.  Court ordered the case adjourned for another status date on 02/11/2015 at 08:30 a.m.

Defendant Timblia Williams in court with attorney Paige A. Styler.  Jeffrey James Altenburg appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Sworn: Dr John Pankiewicz.
  Court finds that the defendant is incompetent to proceed at this time, but if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within 12 months or within the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less. The defendant is commited on 11/12/2014 to the Department of Health and Family Services for an indeterminate term not to exceed 12 months, or the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less. The Court orders the defendant returned to Behavioral Health on todays date until a bed is available at Mendota. The sheriff shall transport the defendant to BHD and from BHD to MENDOTA when a bed becomes available.  
Order of commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed. Case calendared for STATUS on 2/6/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 36.
  Status conference scheduled for 02-06-2015 at 01:30 pm.

The hearing scheduled for 11/12/14 will be held in Judge Watts Court, Room G55 CJF.

Defendant Timblia Williams in court with attorney Paige A Styler.  Jeffrey J Altenburg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  
COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 67
days time served, Huber left open at this time.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2
years with the following conditions:
*
*Court imposed and stayed 90 days condition time to be used by the CCT team.
*Comply with Mental Health Unit.
*Meet with CCT for all phases of the program.  
*Comply with any recommended treatment.
*Follow rules of Manitoba House.
*Sign release forms for all agencies on the CCT as well as any other release necessary for monitoring by the DOC.
*No contact with Rex W. or 7620 W. Keefe Ave.

Probation may terminate early if deemed appropriate by CCT team.
Restitution and Costs and surcharges WAIVED due to inability to pay; he has no income.  

COUNT 2:   The Court sentenced the defendant to serve
 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 
0
days time served, Huber left open at this time.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of

*Meet with CCT for all phases of the program.  
*Comply with any recommended treatment.
*Follow rules of Manitoba House.
*Sign release forms for all agencies on the CCT as well as any other release necessary for monitoring by the DOC.
*No contact with Rex W. or 7620 W. Keefe Ave.

Probation may terminate early if deemed appropriate by CCT team.
Restitution and Costs and surcharges WAIVED due to inability to pay; he has no income.  

Appeal rights given.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Hearing for the 11th of April will be held in Room 634 of the Courthouse.  Sheriff's Dept. will have defendant produced from the HOC for sentencing.  Parties notified.
cab
Bail to convert to $1000 signature bond once housing has been found by Justice point (defendant is turned over to justice point at this time).

Defendant Timblia Williams in court with attorney Paige Styler and Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Timblia Williams in custody.  Jeffrey J. Altenburg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT 1: On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19, a Class A Misd.
AS TO COUNT 2: On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), a Class B Misd.
AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-11-2014 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Timblia Williams not in court, in custody.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  rn  Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Release Conditions Order, signed and filed.  Copy provided to defendant.

TOT to Justice Point, with the following conditions:  No contact with Rex W., no firearms or weapons; take all medications as prescribed and remain on medication; must have verifiable, permanent housing prior to release; random drug testing; no alcohol or illegal substances.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Court set a $1,000.00 signature bond.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defense counsel requested a scheduling date to go over offer and discovery.  Court ordered case adjourned for scheduling before Branch 20.

Defendant Timblia Williams in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Timblia Williams in custody.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are in receipt of the doctor's report.  Defendant, defense counsel nor the State challenge its findings.  The Court finds defendant competent to proceed and ordered proceedings reinstated.
/filed. rn

Defendant Timblia Williams in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Timblia Williams in custody.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause, suspended proceedings and ordered defendant examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Rex W. and the address of 7620 W. Keffe St., Milwaukee, WI.

Defendant Timblia Williams in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Timblia Williams in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
